summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated April 9, 2019, transmitting several legal documents related to unsealing orders in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The email references Judge McMahon's rulings and a conference with her, as well as a submission to Judge Netburn.

persons.name: Judge McMahon
persons.context: Issued a memorandum and order, and a separate unsealing order related to the Epstein case; the sender had a conference with her.

persons.name: Judge Netburn
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient of a letter providing additional authority in connection with a similar unsealing application in her case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the legal proceedings and unsealing orders referenced in the email attachments.

connections.description: Judge McMahon issued judicial orders regarding the unsealing of materials in the Epstein case.
Judge Netburn is presiding over a related case involving an unsealing application concerning Epstein.

events.title: Unsealing Conference with Judge McMahon
events.description: A conference was held before Judge McMahon regarding unsealing orders in the Epstein case, as referenced in a transcript.

events.title: Submission of Authority to Judge Netburn
events.description: A letter providing additional legal authority was submitted to Judge Netburn in connection with a similar unsealing application in her case.

keyFacts: On April 9, 2019, an Assistant U.S. Attorney transmitted several legal documents concerning unsealing orders in the Jeffrey Epstein case.
Judge McMahon issued a memorandum and order, a separate shareable unsealing order, and held a conference regarding the unsealing.
A similar unsealing application was pending before Judge Netburn, to whom additional legal authority was submitted.
The email indicates active legal proceedings in 2019 to unseal materials related to the Epstein case.
